fields.description: The "Resolution Time" report is purported to show the "average time taken to resolve issues."  It appears to use the _resolved_ date field to compute the open time.  When an issue is marked as resolved; however, when the issue is closed (which may happen much later in the lifecycle) the _resolved_ date field is updated with the close date.  This causes the resolution time report to show open-to-closed deltas rather than open-to-resolved.
fields.summary: Resolution Time report shows inaccurate open time

fields.description:
See [JIRA development forum topic|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257328570]

A cutsomfieldtype and custom field searcher modules makes plugins to fail be reloaded on _atlas-cli, pi_ command.

{quote}
Here are the outputs:

1. from atlas-install-plugin:
{code}INFO Install Plugin: Uploading 'plugins-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar' to server: http://localhost:2990/jira
INFO Install Plugin: Completed successfully200.
{code}
Looks good, right?

2. from running jira instance:
{code}
WARNING talledLocalContainer 10-Jan-2010 11:02:07 com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader addFoundPlugins
WARNING talledLocalContainer INFO: No plugins found to be installed
WARNING talledLocalContainer 10-Jan-2010 11:02:08 com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader deployPluginFromUnit
WARNING talledLocalContainer INFO: Plugin Unit: C:\Users\..\target\jira\home\plugins\installed-plugins\plugindev-7092975523946520509plugins-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar (1263114127816) created
{code}
{quote}


Please document this as known issue on JIRA Plugin Development Guide (somewhere in the wiki) as well (until it gets fixed) ..

fields.description:
We consistently get an error in IE8 when users try to start up JIRA 4.0 to login at the default page. The Introduction and Login gadgets are showing but empty. At the top of the browser window the message "An add-on for this website failed to run. Check the security settings in Internet options for potential conflicts" is displayed.
That "An add-on..." message is displayed even if we set it as a trusted site with the lowest possible security level", though with that setting the Introduction and Login gadgets at least render some content.
A yellow triangle with black exclamation mark reports an error as below: 

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.0; Trident/4.0; SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; InfoPath.1)
Timestamp: Fri, 12 Feb 2010 14:50:33 UTC

Message: Automation server can't create object
Line: 19
Char: 25095
Code: 0
URI: http://dadev2008.essex.ac.uk:8181/s/466/1/1.2.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs.js


Also after closing the IE8 dialog that reports the "Automation server" error, the bottom line of the browser window shows a constant "(1 item remaining) Downloading picture http://<ourserver:port>/rest/api/1.0/header-separator?color=ccc&bgcolor=f7f7f7...".

Works fine in Firefox but we cannot force all our users to use that (pity).
fields.summary: IE8 error "Automation server can't create object" trying to load dashboard auiplugin

fields.description:
The activity stream currently displays work log events in this manner:

{noformat}
John Doe updated 2 fields of TST-1 (issue description)
Jane Doe changed the Time Spent to '86400' on TST-2 (issue 2 description)
{noformat}

It would be great to:
* List these events as work being logged instead of issues being updated
* Pretty-printing the durations instead of spitting out durations in terms of seconds
* Include the work log descriptions
fields.summary: Improve work log events in activity stream

fields.description:
I'd really like the ability to add new customfield options to custom fields, as we have one custom field containing many hundreds of customer names, and adding new entries to this list is a bit of a hassle.
Currently only administrators can do this, but we'd like to be able to do it through Jelly scripts and have them executed as a bulk process when added to the system.

Open to other suggestions of how to achieve this without the use of an administrator
fields.summary: Ability to add new custom field options through Jelly Script
The MultiSelectSearcher cannot be used from Plugins 2

fields.description:
1) Start with the dashboard.
2) Click on any link (e.g. an issue link in the activity stream, or "forgot password").
3) Press "back" in the browser.

The gadgets are now at their default vertical size and their contents don't fit.

Reproduces in FireFox/Safari/Chrome but not in any flavour of IE.

Appears to be a regression in 4.0.2, as it does not reproduce on JAC (4.0.1)
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets are all too small after returning to dashboard using browser "Back" button

fields.description:
A colleague captured a screenshot on a Mac OSX machine that uses Kanji / Japanese locale, attached the file to a JIRA issue, and got a 404 when attempting to view the attachment again.  This was the generated URL:

https://<my-jira-domain>/secure/attachment/18246/%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F2010-02-11+12.00.09+PM%3F.png

I don't have the specific error response beyond it being a 404.

JIRA should handle attachments with unusual characters in the filename.  I'm not sure if the source filename was in fact a question-mark, that's unlikely, as they were Kanji characters...


UPDATE: some sample Kanji for issue-repro purposes:
  やっぱり、JIRA　は漢字全然認めない。


UPDATE 2: my attached JPG seems to work well, looks like I need to upgrade....
fields.summary: HTTP 404: attachment files with double-byte (KANJI characters displayed as '?' question marks) in their filenames cannot be served

fields.description:
In the previous JIRA Version 3.11 or 3.13.x the 
- permlink and
- the current view 
in the navigator are permanent visible and easy to find.

Now with JIRA Version 4.0.1 the permlink is an unimpressive symbole. 
Many users have to search for this funktionality.
Also the current view funktions are stored in a separate pulldown menue.
For "poweruser" the old JIRA style was easier to handle.

Is it possible to configure permlink and current view as "old style" or "new style".

Another good feature would be to change the sequence of the columns.

fields.description:
The design of the resolved subtasks has been changed.
In JIRA 3.13.3 the summary of the resolved subtask was written in a strike-through style.
So I find it was easy to see if a subtask is resolved or not.
Is it possible to configure this in the next version?
fields.summary: Design of revolved subtasks (strike-through style)

fields.description:
When creating issues using the on the top right screen, I find it extremely difficult to choose the project that I want to create when it comes to having a long project name. I managed to reproduce the same behavior using Firefox and also in IE8. 

I can only see the remaining project name if I am using a dual monitor screen. 

Please see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Long Project Name Breaks on 'Create Issue' (top right screen)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20379].
  {panel}

We have noticed that, for instance it is possible to type in a username ending in a space into the assign issue field.

There is no validtion on this, and as a result we have issues with spaces at the end in the DB.

This causes no end of pain, expecally when you use external user management.

We solved this by trimming the username (see: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1816)

however, a better fix, would be to force jira to valida/clan usernames for all username fields as they are entered.
fields.summary: Validate Usernames when assigning/searching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20366].
  {panel}

At this moment it only seems to be possible to deploy to the default server instance (the DAS) of a particular Glassfish domain.

In reality it is often necessary to deploy the application to a separate server instance, and not the default DAS instance.

This implies the need to not only create, start, and stop a domain, but also the need to be able to:
create a node agent.
start a node agent.
stop a node agent.
create a server instance.
start a server instance.
stop a server instance.
deploy an application to a particular server instance.

The above functionality would drastically increase productivity and the means to check in an early fase whether the domain-nodeagent-sever instance setup is correct.

Kind regards,
EDH
fields.summary: Deployment to Glassfish server instances

fields.description:
When leaving the JIRA dashboard idle, when it attempts to refresh the security tokens, JavaScript errors are thrown:

Unknown RPC Service: update_security_token

The code in question is:
{noformat}
var g="Class "+H+"
 Private m_Intended
Private m_Auth
Public Sub SetIntendedName(name)
 If isEmpty(m_Intended) Then

m_Intended = name
End If
End Sub
Public Sub SetAuth(auth)
 If isEmpty(m_Auth) Then
m_Auth = auth
End If
End Sub

Public Sub SendMessage(data)
 "+Y+"(data)
End Sub
Public Function GetAuthToken()
 GetAuthToken = m_Auth
End Function

Public Sub CreateChannel(channel, auth)
 Call "+O+"(m_Intended, channel, auth)
End Sub
End Class
Function "+B+"(name, auth)

Dim wrap
Set wrap = New "+H+"
wrap.SetIntendedName name
wrap.SetAuth auth
Set "+B+" = wrap
End Function";
try{window.execScript(g,"vbscript")
}catch(h){I="ifpc"
}}}}var I=Z();
b();
C[P]=function(){throw new Error("Unknown RPC service: "+this.s)
};
{noformat}

It is thrown a number of times, possibly once per gadget on the dashboard.

This is a regression from JIRA 4.0.1.
Reproduces in both IE7 and FireFox 3.5.7.

Caused as a part of the fix to [AG-661|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-661]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20361].
  {panel}

At the moment, the XML view of a filter containing user picker custom fields only shows the user ids. For instance:

{code:xml}
...
<customfield id="customfield_10000" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiuserpicker">
    <customfieldname>Authors</customfieldname>
        <customfieldvalues>
            <customfieldvalue>userone</customfieldvalue>
            <customfieldvalue>usertwo</customfieldvalue>
        </customfieldvalues>
    </customfield>
...
{code}

In a way, this makes sense, because the user id is the unique identifier of a user. However, there are other applications that use this information and present it to the end customer. For instance, the confluence jiraissue macro uses the XML view to present the data in the Confluence page. That results in a macro that only shows the user id, which most of the times is not meaningful to the end user.

I would be good if the customfieldvalue could be improved to return userid, username, and user profile url, so the macro could present more meaningful view to the end user.

Of course, this should not break backwards compatibility of the XML view.
fields.summary: XML view for filters containing user picker fields should return both userid and user full name

fields.description:
Our problem is, that we can't set our main Jira instance to the outside world (security breach). So we want to run 2 Jira Instances.

One only accessible from the intranet for adjusting the development team and another (integrated into our Website) to get (anonymous/registered) feedback/bugs from external users of our Software.

The problem is the synchronization of these two instances.
It would be great, if there could be an automatic way to sync this two instances. Otherwise every developer had to watch and work on 2 different instances.

One way would be: If internal is A and external B, the internal should show A+B and the external only B.

I think, the main feature lies inside the automatic push/pull creation of new tickets from one instance to another. A more complex feature might be the complete automatic linking of issues across multiple instances so that you can make changes at both sides witch will be synchronized across the instances.
fields.summary: automatic linking between multiple Jira instances

fields.description:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
A patch for 4.1.2 is available that fixes one category of known causes of this problem. Instructions for applying this patch are available [^JRA-20351-4.1.2-patch-instructions.txt].

The patch is to basically replace the {{axis-1.3.jar}} in your JIRA install with the attached {{axis-1.3-altassian-1.jar}}. You must make sure you remove {{axis-1.3.jar}} or the patch may not work.
{panel}

It seems that the AXIS internal map of SOAP types is not stable.

The WSDL generated by JIRA changes over time, especially after certain SOAP requests are made.

For example of this see  JRA-19928

Other customers have reported that after a certain time the actual SOAP messages send back have different types

For example this is from a support case

{code}
When I start up JIRA and make a SOAP request for bug info (any old bug), I get (for example):

</fixVersions><id xsi:type="xsd:string">23835
</id><key xsi:type="xsd:string">SS-4096
</key><priority xsi:type="xsd:string">7
</priority><project xsi:type="xsd:string">SS
</project><reporter xsi:type="xsd:string">breichle
</reporter><resolution xsi:type="xsd:string">1
</resolution><status xsi:type="xsd:string">6
</status><summary xsi:type="xsd:string">Sorting by Time column
</summary><type xsi:type="xsd:string">1
</type>

After some time, I make the same request and I get:

<fixVersions soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteVersion[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array"><fixVersions href="#id6"/>
</fixVersions><id xsi:type="soapenc:string">23835
</id><key xsi:type="soapenc:string">SS-4096
</key><priority xsi:type="soapenc:string">7
</priority><project xsi:type="soapenc:string">SS
</project><reporter xsi:type="soapenc:string">breichle
</reporter><resolution xsi:type="soapenc:string">1
</resolution><status xsi:type="soapenc:string">6
</status><summary xsi:type="soapenc:string">Sorting by Time column
</summary><type xsi:type="soapenc:string">1
</type>
{code}


Breden Bain did some investigations into this and found that the AXIS code does in fact change "serializers" in its internal map over time.  not being an AXIS expert (and the fact that the code is complicated to say the least) he did not spend more time on it.

We need to get to the bottom of this as more and more support cases are coming in with this problem.

This is a placeholder issue to allow that work to be done.

As of JIRA 4.3.4 this problem is still occuring. e.g. support case EHSP-18282

The return types are base 64 encoded like this:

{code:xml}
<customfieldId xsi:type="ns17:String" xmlns:ns17="http://lang.java"><bytes xsi:type="xsd:base64Binary">Y3VzdG9tZmllbGRfMTA0NjE=</bytes><empty xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</empty></customfieldId>
{code}
fields.summary: AXIS internal SOAP type representation is unstable.

The XML view of the issue navigator is expensive; more expensive than RSS, Excel or Word. Currently there are two properties that can limit the reuslts:

fields.description:
We have the following requirement:
We have a custom field named "Customer". It is not required to fill out that field.

Now if this field is filled out and someone is changing the issue field "version" to another version or is changing the remaining estimation to another value then JIRA should notify the user that there was a change.

This is important because we have internal and external requirements. If it is a external requirement of a customer and we are changing the estimation (it means: we need more time or we are faster) or if we switch the requirement to a later or earlier version then the worker at the ticket should be notified if the field "customer" is filled out. The reason is that the worker can sent the customer a quick feedback that something on his requirement has changed in estimation or version.
fields.summary: Get user notified if changes on issue field is made

fields.description:
The instance of JIRA use crowd (2.0.3) for user management.
In JIRA the following property is on: External user management
In Jira a member of the jira-user group has the right to create an issue

Steps done:
In crowd:
1) create user
2) add user to group jira-user

In Jira
1) log in as the new user -> no right to create an issue
2) log in as an administrator
3) in "user browser" screen search for the new user -> he exists and he is in group "jira-user"
4) click on jira-user group -> the user is not part of the list of users ????

So from the user view we see that the user is member of "jira-user" but in group view the user is not member.

I had to restart jira for him to be "full" member, I did not wait for cache expiration.
fields.summary: User added to group in crowd is not visible in JIRA group view

Please provide hierarchical search capability.

Example

Original Filter
project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL AND comment !~ "##RMVerif"

Due to database having > 65000 issues that match this criteria - the following message is produced:  "The clause 'comment !~ "##RMVerif*"' is too general to perform a search. Please refine your query and try the search again."

If I remove the Comment portion of the filter and make it
project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL
this produces @ 300 issues.

so what we really want to know is - of those 300 - which have this - comment !~ "##RMVerif"

I even tried the following
(project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL) AND comment !~ "##RMVerif*"

(project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL) AND NOT comment ~ "##RMVerif*"

thinking that it would perform the search with in the parens first and then based on those results look for issues where the comment was not "##RMVerif" - still no luck.
fields.summary: JQL / Filter - provide hierarchy logic

Not sure if the summary makes sense, but when you're releasing a version, it asks if you want to move unresolved issues to a different version. That drop down list shows all unreleased versions, but this also includes archived unreleased versions.

The versions should not appear in this list.

When copying and pasting the SOH (ascii 0x01) character from a windows cmd terminal into an issue description, the issue creation (or update) fails.

Error on issue creation failed page is:

{noformat}

I've attached the log, which contains the description I tried to use.

Note that when the windows cmd renders this character, it is a small smiley face. I do not know why.

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Stack trace (from 500 page):

{quote}
2010-02-03 17:12:19,980 http-8080-Processor23 [webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher] Could not execute action
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeTransformResult.addRoleMappingForGroup(SchemeTransformResult.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.transformScheme(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.doTransform(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.scheme.mapper.DefaultSchemeGroupsToRoleTransformerService.doTransform(DefaultSchemeGroupsToRoleTransformerService.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupToRoleTransformerAction.doDefault(SchemeGroupToRoleTransformerAction.java:50)
{quote}

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create a group *testgroup*
# Add group to an event in *Default Notification Scheme*
# Delete group *testgroup*
# Go to _Administration > Scheme Tools > Group to Project Role Mapping Tool_
# From the dropdown select *notification scheme* and then from the list select *Default Notification Scheme* and then click _Map Groups to Roles_
# Next to the group *testgroup* select the dropdown *Users* and click _Preview Mappings_
# 500 page with exception is shown

I guess this is a bug in two ways:
* NullPointerException shouldn't be thrown. There should be some way of mapping out the non-existent group to a project role.
* *But more importantly,* when you delete a group, it should delete associated scheme entities

We should at least have a check for this in the Integrity Checker?

h4. Workaround
As a workaround for this bug, we can remove the groups that no longer exists from the Notification schemes and Permission Schemes.

We can find what schemes have non-existant groups by running the following queries on your database

*Notification Schemes:*
{code:SQL}
select NS.name,N.notif_parameter
from notification N
join notificationscheme NS on N.scheme=NS.id
where N.notif_type = 'Group_Dropdown'
  and N.notif_parameter not in (select group_name from cwd_group)
group by NS.name,N.notif_parameter
{code}
*Permission Schemes:*
{code:SQL}
select PS.name,P.perm_parameter
from schemepermissions P
join permissionscheme PS on P.scheme=PS.id
where P.perm_type = 'group'
  and P.perm_parameter not in (select group_name from cwd_group)
group by PS.name,P.perm_parameter
{code}

Navigate on JIRA to the Notification/Permission scheme returned by the query and remove the groups specified by the queries.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when trying to map non-existent group in Notification Scheme to project role using Group to Project Role Mapping Tool

# Login as a user with English locale.
# View an issue with time tracking. Notice that days is abbreviated "j".

fields.summary: Ability to use 24-hour time format when logging work

fields.description:
The following fragment fails with XML-RPC updateIssue failing with xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String'>

				updIssue = self.JiraProxy.jira1.getIssue(self.token, issue['key'])
				print 'Retrieved details OK\n'
				updIssue['assignee'] = newUser
				print 'Updating issue\n'
				self.JiraProxy.jira1.updateIssue(self.token, issue['key'], updIssue)

Retrieval works, but updateIssue fails, however I try. It even fails if I do a createIssue then use the returned Hashtable to do an updateIssue.

Is this fixed in a more recent version?
fields.summary: XML-RPC updateIssue failing with xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String'>

fields.description: The default text renderer renders quite arbitrary text containing an "@" sign as email address, even if it isn't a valid email address. For example: mscorwks.dll!@JIT_MonExitWorker@4() + 0xb bytes is rendered as:   mscorwks.dll!@JIT_MonExitWorker@4() + 0xb bytes Admittedly, the border between "valid email address" and "arbitrary text containing @" is a bit fuzzy, but it should probably be a bit more conservative about what it considers an email address.
fields.summary: Default text render renders text containing at-sign as email address

fields.description:
Hello,

Lately when the users create a ticket, this ticket is automatically assigned to the projecte lead.
Normally, according to the workflow the ticket should be assigned to another user.

Furthermore, in the issue details the current assignee is this another user, but this user does not see any issue assigned to him.
When i try to filter the issues, then I see that the assignee is the project lead.

Could it be that there is somewhere a contradiction in the assignements?
fields.summary: Issues gets assigned to project lead instead of other user.

fields.description: The .jira-home.lock should be removed from the home directory when restarting Windows, and therefore stopping the service. However, there are several reports that indicate that, under certain circumstances, that is not the case is the OS is running in a virtualised environment, like VmWare ESX.
fields.summary: .jira-home.lock not removed when restarting Windows in a virtualised environment

fields.description:
All cache flushing would be nice. This request is specifically about user and password caches.

Note:
# Custom field caches can be flushed using the Remote API
# OptionSetManager, GenericConfigManager, FieldConfigSchemeManager and FieldConfigSchemePersister can be flushed by adding the line (at line 46):
bq. <%((JiraCachedManager) ComponentManager.getComponentInstanceOfType(aClass)).refreshCache();%>
To the file <jira-install>/atlassian-jira/secure/admin/cacheViewer.jsp. (one is attached).

The user cache appears to be in ExternalEntityJiraProfileProvider, but that's not flushing from a JSP.
fields.summary: Ability to flush user and password caches

fields.description:
Xerox has requested additional request type options when creating LMS specific tickets via the portal.  Currently when creating a ticket to either remove log sources and/or to add/delete reports created out of ArcSight, Xerox is using the general request type 'LMS - Incident - Other'.  They are requesting we add new request types to specify their more popular requests.  Suggested request types:

LMS - Remove log sources
LMS - Add/Modify/Delete report

Attached is a screen shot of the request types currently listed.
fields.summary: Addtional 'request types' within the drop-down menus when creating tickets via the portal

fields.description: If a date picker popup (ie: Due Date field) overlaps another field with ajax suggestions (ie: Reporter field), then the popup display shows blank portions. To reproduce the problem, place the Due Date field slightly below the Reporter field, then type into the Reporter field to bring up ajax suggestions. Now if the date popup is brought onto the screen, the portion that overlaps with the Reporter field will be displayed as blank.
fields.summary: Date picker popup displays blank when overlapping fields with ajax suggestions

I wrote a REST plugin that has a resource to create lots of text custom fields. Occasionally I see an error that looks suspiciously like some id is not being flushed out of a cache in the GenericDelegator.
Using CoreFactory.getGenericDelegator().refreshSequencer(); after every call to createCustomField() seems to fix it.

fields.description:
If the resolution field is included on a transition (for example, from resolved->closed), the resolution date is updated whether or not the value changes.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new screen that includes the resolution field
# Create a new workflow (based on the default, for example)
# Edit the resolved->closed transition and associate it with the new screen
# Create a new workflow scheme and associate the new workflow with all issue types
# Configure a project to use the new workflow scheme
# Resolve the issue, including a comment. Note the time of the comment and the resolved date.
# Wait at least one minute.
# Close the issue *without changing the resolution*.  Include a comment.  Note that the resolved date matches the time of the comment on the resolved->closed transition.

You could argue that changing the resolution should update the resolved date (although that's not entirely obvious), but simply including the resolution on a transition shouldn't force a change.
fields.summary: Date resolved is updated whenever resolution is included in transition screen

fields.description:
The multi-user picker inserts extra spaces between existing usernames every time a new user is added.

Repro steps:
1) Add a multi-user custom field to a project.
2) Create a new issue.
3) Start typing a name. Press <enter> to accept the autocomplete.
4) Repeat step 3 with a different name.
5) Repeat step 3 with a different name. At this point, an extra space will be inserted between the first two names.
6) Repeat step 3 with a different name. Extra spaces will be inserted between the first three names.

For example,
{noformat}
Step 3:     "pwyatt, "
Step 4:     "pwyatt, qazwsx, "
Step 5:     "pwyatt,  qazwsx, admin06, "
Step 6:     "pwyatt,   qazwsx,  admin06, test1111111, "
Eventually: "pwyatt,        qazwsx,       admin06,      test1111111,     testeneto,    afra,   1test,  abcde, testing2009, "
{noformat}
fields.summary: Multi-User Picker inserts extra spaces every time a user is selected

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new CVS module with a timeout of 3,600,000 seconds (3600000)
# View the resultant details on the list of CVS Modules: module displays timeout as "-694967 seconds"
# Go back to edit and the same value is displayed in the input box
# View the record in the database and it is being stored as {{-694967296}}

There's a whole bunch of messy conversion code in the CVS Modules. Integers multiplied by 1000 and then stored as Strings, only to be retrieved out as Integers again by dividing by 1000. This needs to be cleaned up, and Longs need to be used instead of Integers.
fields.summary: CVS module timeout is stored incorrectly as an integer multiplied by 1000 and can lead to integer overflow problems

fields.description:
From fieldtype-oracle10g.xml:
<field-type-def type="date-time" sql-type="DATE" java-type="java.sql.Timestamp"></field-type-def>

We should be using an sql-type of "TIMESTAMP" instead of "DATE"

More info here:
http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/B19306_01/server.102/b14220/datatype.htm#i1847
fields.summary: Only storing date-time to second precision for Jira instances using Oracle
